title.narrative: Harmonisation du droit de l'environnement en Afrique de l'Ouest francophone
Harmonization of Environmental Law in Francophone West Africa

description.narrative:
Africa's environmental resources hold vast potential for social and economic development. To sustain these important natural resources, countries need to work together to implement effective environmental laws.
Over the past decade, many African countries have established environmental protection laws. They have also made great strides in building and strengthening the governance systems to support the legal basis for advancing compliance with and enforcement of environmental law. However, while most countries in the region have environmental protection laws, many government agencies face technical and logistical challenges in implementing them.
This research will support the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) to organize a brainstorming and discussion workshop on implementing environmental law in francophone Africa. Participants will look at how to harmonize laws among countries and implement them more effectively, particularly laws around inclusive management of natural resources in West Africa.
The workshop will identify the challenges in implementing environmental law in Africa, and will encourage participants to share their views and propose solutions. Among issues they will consider are the role each country can play, initiatives to increase compliance with environmental conservation laws, and institutional changes to improve environmental management. The workshop is also designed to solicit feedback on the urgent need to adopt measures to enforce environmental standards.
By the end of the workshop, participants will have:
* identified the main players responsible for implementing environmental law in francophone Africa; * diagnosed and analyzed the causes of ineffective implementation of environmental laws and identified potential solutions to them; * defined an institutional mechanism to implement these solutions nationally and/or regionally; and * identified key areas of an African strategy for implementing environmental law.
